title: cmd/gc: compiler speed regression; 1 minute CPU time
body:
What does 'go version' print?
go version devel +c2481883c1af Mon Jun 02 14:43:51 2014 +1000 linux/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

1. go get github.com/dominikh/go-js-dom
2.
3.

What happened?
The 6g process required ~700 MB of RES memory and took over a minute to complete

What should have happened instead?
It shouldn't take considerably longer than Go 1.2 did, which required about 2 seconds

Please provide any additional information below.
Attached is the shell session of two runs, one building the package with Go 1.2, one
with Go tip, and the time they took.
Attachments: 1. log.txt (2673 bytes)
